title.narrative: DISASTER RISK REDUCTION

description.narrative: Children and adolescents from communities vulnerable to multi-risk have capacities to participate in the design and implementation of risk reduction plans., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, more early childhood children, children with disabilities, adolescents from trade schools and children and adolescents living in territories vulnerable to disasters have inclusive, quality and relevant education, even in emergencies or disasters.

mailing-address.narrative: Calle 1ra B No. 15802 esquina a 158 Reparto Náutico Playa Ciudad de la Habana Cuba

sector.narrative: Disaster risk reduction and / or climate change adaptation programming

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents from communities vulnerable to multi-risk have capacities to participate in the design and implementationof risk reduction plans.

description.narrative: UNICEF Cuba has contributed to the participation of more than 680 early childhood educators, families of children with disabilities and adolescents and young climate change activists, in actions to promote inclusive disaster risk reduction management from a multi-risk perspective, and the empowerment of adolescents in the face of the negative effects of climate change. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:14/01/2022
